TopicTitle: Kerbin loads on top of Minmus after loading a quicksave in Minmus orbit

Articles.Content: I was doing a Minmus mission, had landed on Minmus, returned to the orbiting module, and quicksaved. I then ditched the lander and started a return burn to kerbin, but due to some bug, after finishing the planned maneuver I'd apparently burned in the opposite direction (I'd checked I was controlling from the top of the capsule so my orientation wasn't inverted, it seems like it was a maneuver node bug), so I was now on a de-orbiting trajectory from Kerbin. So I hit F9 to load the latest quicksave, got a short 2 or 3 second load screen, and was greeted to what you see in the screenshot. Still orbiting Minmus, but with Kerbin's model loaded into the scene.

11 minutes ago, Tile said:

I was doing a Minmus mission, had landed on Minmus, returned to the orbiting module, and quicksaved. I then ditched the lander and started a return burn to kerbin, but due to some bug, after finishing the planned maneuver I'd apparently burned in the opposite direction (I'd checked I was controlling from the top of the capsule so my orientation wasn't inverted, it seems like it was a maneuver node bug), so I was now on a de-orbiting trajectory from Kerbin. So I hit F9 to load the latest quicksave, got a short 2 or 3 second load screen, and was greeted to what you see in the screenshot. Still orbiting Minmus, but with Kerbin's model loaded into the scene.

Serious data scoping issues is what it looks like, but idk, just my opinion from 200,000+ meters
